title: Don’t line up at filling stations for next three days, appeal from Energy Minister
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Kanchana Wijesekera, Sri Lanka’s Power and Energy Minister on Monday (16) said with the arrival of the Diesel cargo on Sunday (15) and 3 vessels to reach Sri Lanka in the next 2 weeks on the Indian credit line, adequate fuel will be made available.
In a tweet, the Minister requested the public not to queue up or top up the next 3 days until the 1,190 fuel station deliveries are completed.
Group of 10 Parties to support Ranil’s Govt, but will NOT accept ministerial posts – Gammanpila
Don’t line up at filling stations for next three days, appeal from Energy Minister
